main event: A commercial airline pilot reported seeing a round black object followed by silver streaks that appeared to speed up and down on its course over San Francisco, California on February 13, 1953.
interesting points: The object emitted a throbbing sound described as a 'swish' or 'whistle',The sighting was reported by multiple observers at different locations including Mount Sutro,Thousands of persons reportedly observed similar objects over the Bay area during the early morning and evening of the same date,Weather conditions included fair skies with a few scattered clouds,Dr. Otto Struve, an astronomer, suggested the sightings could be explained by a temperature inversion due to weather conditions.
sighted object: a round black object with silver trails
witness description: observers located at GOC post and other locations
